image.altText: A damaged, waterlogged road

props.synopsis: The WA opposition says flood damage to the Geraldton-Mount Magnet road shows investment in country roads is being deeply under-resourced.

title.children: Outback truckers halted for days after deluge destroys road, prompting calls for more investment

image.altText: Alcohol stacked up which was seized by Kimberley police

props.synopsis: WA police write a second letter to the state's director of liquor licensing, Lanie Chopping, urging her to consider widespread liquor restrictions, according to documents obtained by the ABC under freedom of information laws.

title.children: WA police double down on calls for alcohol restrictions in regional towns

image.altText: A sign out the front of Bacchus Marsh Grammar.

props.synopsis: A parent of a student at Bacchus Marsh Grammar says her daughter was physically ill after seeing fake digital images of students distributed online. A teenager has been arrested and released pending further enquiries.

title.children: 'It's traumatising': Parent shocked at fake nude images of Victorian students

image.altText: A grey navy patrol boat sails into a harbour on a cloudy day, with mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: A Pacific patrol boat has run aground on its maiden voyage in Fiji, just a few months after it was handed over by the Australian government.

title.children: Fiji Navy patrol boat gifted by Australia runs aground on maiden voyage

image.altText: An ambulance parked next to the Casuarina Prison sign

props.synopsis: A CCC report into events surrounding the death of Cleveland Dodd paints a picture of a youth detention facility with procedures in place to protect children, but which was too overrun for officers to adequately enforce them. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: One of our most vulnerable children was let down in the worst way possible — and we now know how

image.altText: A court sketch shows a side profile of Hunter Biden sitting in court.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden's status as a convicted liar could breathe some life into Republicans' efforts to bring down his father, while complicating the mileage Joe Biden can get out of Donald Trump's legal woes.

title.children: The Biden family is putting on brave faces, but Hunter's conviction is a huge blow

image.altText: A man grimaces with his mouth as he stares straight ahead

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old was last year sentenced to nearly five years in prison for sexually assaulting a woman in her Newcastle home on the night of the 2018 NRL grand final.

title.children: Jarryd Hayne to be released from jail after sexual assault convictions quashed

image.altText: A man smiling and standing infront of a big red car

props.synopsis: Chinese-made electric cars are gaining popularity as a cheaper alternative to brand names like Tesla, and Australia is benefiting from the increased supply.

title.children: Cheaper Chinese electric cars are making their way into Australia, but it's not all good news

image.altText: An Israeli military convoy

props.synopsis: Australian billionaire Andrew Forrest has offered to build and install automated gates at Gaza border crossings to improve the flow of aid into the region, but first it has to be acceptable to the Israelis.

title.children: Mining magnate Andrew Forrest offers to overhaul Gaza border crossings to improve aid flow

image.altText: A tank manouvering.

props.synopsis: Qatari and Egyptian mediators say Hamas has submitted a response to the proposed Gaza ceasefire backed by the UN.

title.children: Hamas submits response to proposed Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: Bearded man wearing suit eats apple in front of retro court building.

props.synopsis: Tactical protective clothing worn by police officers began to melt and disintegrate after Daniel Gandini allegedly splashed them with acid while they attempted to arrest him, a Tasmanian court hears.

title.children: 'Diplomat Dan' wore goggles and allegedly threw acid on officers when they breached door during siege, court hears

image.altText: The High Court of Australia building in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The High Court rules a five-year jail term handed to a Sydney man convicted of fighting with terrorist groups linked to Al Qaeda is not excessive despite Commonwealth law stopping him from being granted parole.

title.children: Five-year jail term for convicted foreign fighter upheld by High Court

image.altText: A close-up of Dr Michael Mosley talking while leaning his head on his right hand.

props.synopsis: British TV presenter Michael Mosley is reported to have died of natural causes after going missing in Greece. What should Australians do in an emergency situation overseas?

title.children: What should you do in an emergency situation overseas?

image.altText: Celine Dion with arms up handing what appears to be a portrait

props.synopsis: Celine Dion has opened up in an interview ahead of the release of her documentary I Am: Celine Dion. The star says she was sick of lying to her fans by not disclosing her stiff person syndrome diagnosis.

title.children: Celine Dion says she couldn't lie to her fans anymore, opens up about stiff person syndrome

image.altText: A split image shows two men wearing suits, one older with a tie, one younger

props.synopsis: The horrible truth is that in the Australian legacy media landscape, there are too many stories of senior men who forgive themselves their own lapses of judgement, or forgive each other's because they're "good blokes", or go easy on each other because they fear a nuclear escalation.

title.children: The shamelessness of powerful men in Australia's media industry knows no bounds

image.altText: A girl with red hair wears a green shirt

props.synopsis: Graduation should be a time of celebration, but for the survivors of one of the US's deadliest school shootings, the moment is also one of grief.

title.children: 'There is a whole chunk of our class missing': Sandy Hook survivors reflect on graduating without former classmates

image.altText: Close-up of seven eggs sitting in a cardboard carton.

props.synopsis: Following the news some supermarkets are limiting how many eggs you can buy, you might be wondering how you can make the ones you have last.

title.children: The best way to store eggs and how to know if they've gone bad

image.altText: An Aboriginal ma wearing a hat and black shirt stands with his hands clasped among Eucalyptus leaves and branches.

props.synopsis: For three decades, hundreds of notebooks filled with detailed descriptions of sacred Indigenous practices were locked away in a museum's archives. Now, Ngadjuri man Vincent Copley Junior hopes to finally have access to his great-grandfather's history.

title.children: Hopes anthropologists' notes will answer questions for Indigenous communities after 30-year embargo lifts

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus looks towards the pool while wearing goggles at the Australian Olympic swimming trials.

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus and Mollie O'Callaghan lead the qualifiers for Wednesday night's 200m freestyle final in one of the most stacked fields in history at the Australian Olympic Trials.

title.children: Olympic revenge on the line at Australian Swimming Trials in 'stacked' women's 200m

image.altText: The window of an Apple store with a large Apple logo on it

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower on Wednesday, extending its losses from the previous session. It comes after Apple's share price set a new record, as did the S&P 500 and Nasdaq for the second-straight day. Follow live.

title.children: Apple shares hit record high after launching AI plans, local share market extends losses for second day

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Need a refresher on consulting firms and the Senate inquiry examining them?
ASX opens lower as Bapcor continues gains on takeover talk
WeWork CEO steps down as company emerges from bankruptcy

image.altText: Joe Biden stands behind Hunter Biden, who is pointing at something. A black car is in the background.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden becomes the first child of a sitting US president to be convicted of a crime after he's found guilty of three gun charges that could see him jailed.

title.children: 'I will always be there for Hunter': Joe Biden's show of support after jury convicts his son

image.altText: Mitch Marsh congratulates Adam Zampa during men's T20 World Cup.

props.synopsis: Adam Zampa has continued his brilliant form in the West Indies, picking up another four wickets as Australia cruised to a nine-wicket win over Namibia in Antigua, but he wasn't fully impressed with his outing.

title.children: 'Couple of pies': Zampa's harsh self-analysis after reaching magical mark in T20 World Cup win

image.altText: Woman with dark hair holding toddler son

props.synopsis: Families say they are having to visit up to 10 pharmacies to find a key medication used to treat chest infections, whooping cough, and other respiratory issues in children.

title.children: Australia faces critical shortage of children's antibiotic as whooping cough cases soar

image.altText: Male farmer sitting in utility looking out at solar development

props.synopsis: A farmer with $50 million in public liability insurance says it will not be enough should a fire jump from his place into a new neighbouring solar farm. He says it isn't sufficient to cover "rebuilding an industrial estate" and wants the industry pick up the slack.

title.children: With a solar farm moving in next door, Stephen is worried about his insurance

image.altText: Stephanie Kemmerer, smiling widely, wears singlet with words: Former conspiracy theorist. She has curly fair hair and tattooes.

props.synopsis: In the depths of the conspiracy world, Stephanie Kemmerer hated herself and everyone around her. She felt trapped in disinformation — but here's how she finally got out.

title.children: These people were deep conspiracy theory believers for years. Then came an earth-shattering moment

image.altText: A man in an anorak takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Melbourne man Ilker has been dealing with fraudulent traffic offences, public transport fines and financial crime for three years, since his licence details were stolen.

title.children: Identity fraud victim fears for his safety after hit-run committed in car hired under his name

image.altText: A firefighter carries injured chickens in a cage following a fire.

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 exotic animals, reptiles and pets have perished in a sprawling market in Thailand's capital Bangkok after a fire ripped through over a hundred shops in the early hours of Tuesday.

title.children: 'Shame on Bangkok': Famous Thailand market criticised as fire kills more than 1,000 animals

image.altText: A man with shedding skin looks into the distance

props.synopsis: Jordan Hendey used topical steroids to help his eczema since he was a baby. Now he's asking Australian dermatologists  to address its possible side-effects.

title.children: Jordan was in so much pain he couldn't hug his partner. But he had to go to Thailand to receive any help

image.altText: A fin whale in the sea.

props.synopsis: Animal rights activists have described the decision to kill 128 fin whales as inhumane after the Iceland government issued a licence to a fin whaling company.

title.children: 128 fin whales will be killed and hunted in Iceland this year

image.altText: Houses under construction in the background with building materials in the foreground

props.synopsis: Huge demand and lack of supply paint a grim picture for anyone saving to buy their first home, analysts warn.

title.children: Median income earners pushed out of property market amid 'astronomical' price growth

image.altText: Girl in school uniform, striped shirt, grey sweater, nose ring, black hair tied, slight smile. Graphic of money, coffee, chips.

props.synopsis: Employers can pay youngsters aged below 21 less than the minimum wage. But some say it is not a fair deal and are pushing for equal pay.

title.children: Jayda was excited when she got her first pay cheque. Then, she looked at the hourly rate

image.altText: A man in a suit with pursed lips

props.synopsis: The tearful interview comes as celebrities defend the actor, who has been out of work since allegations of sexual misconduct, amid a new documentary.

title.children: Kevin Spacey admits to being 'too handsy' in apparent attempt to revive acting career

image.altText: Two women in red bathers are drinking through straws from a soft drink bottel

props.synopsis: When Camey O'Keefe landed her first job as a creative in advertising, the casting brief called for a "blonde with biggies". Two decades later, are sexist ads finally a thing of the past?

title.children: Are we finally seeing inclusive and authentic women in ads?
